messages.subject: Re: [HEM-Unschooling] Unschooling Podcast?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/25/2006 7:39:03 PM Central Daylight Time, queana7@comcast.net writes: Sorry  for those who see this several times!  Any other
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/25/2006 7:39:03 PM Central Daylight Time,
queana7@... writes:

Sorry for those who see this several times! Any other podcast-listeners out
there? Why isn't there a good unschooling one? People write such
incredible, beautiful, thoughtful things every day! Wouldn't it be great to
have even just a weekly sampling of the best unschooling
writings-of-the-week in audio format?

Anyone interested in doing this? If there's interest, I'd do it but if
someone else is working on it I don't want to steal their thunder. I am
aware of the radio Freeschool program and I enjoy it. But I would like to
see (hear) something regularly and specifically about unschooling, and not
from any one or a few experts but from lots of voices!

Anybody else?



I think that sounds like such a great idea. I would really be into
listening to something like that.

~Alyssa
Slightly crunchy, unschooling Mom to Landen(2 1/2) and Gage(6 months)

"Work like you don't need the money, love like you've never been hurt, and
dance like you do when nobody's watching."



(http://lilypie.com/)

(http://lilypie.com/)

Together a Lifetime
(http://daisypath.com/)



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
